definition: to move (i.e. relocate oneself)/to move (sth relatively heavy or bulky)/to shift/to copy indiscriminately
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: Convey Field Company is fastidious about the technical transportation, our predominance is the labor.
sentences.chinese: 搬場公司是講究技術的運輸，我們的優勢就是工人。

sentences.english: The computer got (was)damaged when we were moving.
sentences.chinese: 我們搬場的時辰，電腦碰壞了。

sentences.english: It was around a week after moving day.
Job of staff of a few pinchbeck remove furniture is coarse, throw bad furniture electric equipment.
sentences.chinese: 一些冒牌搬場人員工作粗糙，摔壞傢俱電器。

sentences.english: Suddenly, I remembered moving day, how I felt so wretched, and for some reason, I was glad we moved.
sentences.chinese: 俄然，我記起了搬場那天，我曾覺患上那樣子的不幸。

sentences.english: When you move, let me know your new address.
sentences.chinese: 你如果搬場，必患上告訴我你的新地址。
